2.text: “Even today my complaint is rebellious. His hand is heavy in spite of my groaning.

3.text: Oh that I knew where I might find him! That I might come even to his seat!

4.text: I would set my cause in order before him, and fill my mouth with arguments.

5.text: I would know the words which he would answer me, and understand what he would tell me.

6.text: Would he contend with me in the greatness of his power? No, but he would listen to me.

7.text: There the upright might reason with him, so I should be delivered forever from my judge.

8.text: “If I go east, he is not there; if west, I can’t find him;

9.text: He works to the north, but I can’t see him. He turns south, but I can’t catch a glimpse of him.

10.text: But he knows the way that I take. When he has tried me, I shall come forth like gold.

11.text: My foot has held fast to his steps. I have kept his way, and not turned aside.

12.text: I haven’t gone back from the commandment of his lips. I have treasured up the words of his mouth more than my necessary food.

13.text: But he stands alone, and who can oppose him? What his soul desires, even that he does.

14.text: For he performs that which is appointed for me. Many such things are with him.

15.text: Therefore I am terrified at his presence. When I consider, I am afraid of him.

16.text: For God has made my heart faint. The Almighty has terrified me.

17.text: Because I was not cut off before the darkness, neither did he cover the thick darkness from my face.
